article: As I was driving out of the store parking lot, they crossed in front of me.My first reaction was filled with _ at being delayed for a whole ten seconds.But I quickly became _ when I realized that it was an elderly _ . The man leaned on his _ who walked in front of him.He not only used her for _ but it was obvious that he was blind.The two of them _ as one--each needing the other to _ in this fast-changing world. That little example of true strength _ my whole personal perception of life that day.Suddenly I wasn't so mad about having to work a few extra hours on Saturdays.I had my _ ,and I was still _ young. That picture of those two elderly people walking with dignity and strength stayed with me the entire week.My _ wasn't so bad after all.I had my health and a good job.I had a wonderful, _ wife.I started to think--not only was I _ to have these all, but so was that wonderful old couple,who, despite the trials and sufferings of a long life,still had the love and support of each other to _ them through this world. There are so many people out there just like that couple.My wife and I sometimes _ ourselves in our old age, walking arm in arm into the sunset. That image always gives us a _ feeling.Just remember, none of us would be here if it wasn't for our elders.We all should spend a little extra time and patience, when it comes to helping our elder friends.
